name: Piracetam
summary: Piracetam is a nootropic compound of the racetam family, used primarily to enhance cognitive function and, in some countries, to treat neurological disorders such as dementia, cognitive decline, and myoclonus.
description: Piracetam is a cyclic derivative of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) but does not act directly on GABA receptors. Instead, it is thought to modulate neurotransmission, enhance neuronal membrane fluidity, and improve microcirculation in the brain. It has been studied for use in cognitive impairment, Alzheimer's disease, stroke recovery, and myoclonus. Although widely used in some countries, piracetam is not FDA-approved in the United States and is considered a supplement or research chemical there.

off_label_uses: Learning and memory enhancement in healthy individuals
contraindications: Hypersensitivity to piracetam or other racetams
monitoring_required: Response in cognitive and neurological status

items: Adjunctive therapy in cognitive impairment and dementia

sections.text: Piracetam modulates neurotransmission by influencing ion channels and carriers, enhancing neuronal membrane fluidity, and increasing oxygen and glucose utilization in the brain.

adult.Myoclonus: Start at 7.2 g/day orally in divided doses; may increase to 24 g/day

pediatric.text: Not routinely used; safety not well established

sections.geriatric: Dose adjustment may be necessary for renal impairment

sections.text: Onset: May require days to weeks for cognitive effects; Duration: effects maintained with continued dosing

items: Renal function before and during therapy

sections.lactation: Unknown if excreted in breast milk; caution advised

sections.text: Gradual dose reduction recommended in patients with myoclonus to prevent rebound symptoms
